last_episode_to_air.name: If You Wanna Show, I'll Give You One
last_episode_to_air.overview: On the season Finale of Friday Night Tykes, two champions will be crowned.

name: Friday Night Tykes
overview: In America, football is king ... and nowhere is football bigger than in Texas. Esquire Network takes viewers inside the grown-up world of youth football in FRIDAY NIGHT TYKES, a new 10-part docuseries airing Tuesdays at 9p e/p, debuting January 14 with two back-to-back episodes at 9p and 10p e/p. With exclusive access to the 8 to 9 year-old Rookies division in the San Antonio region of the Texas Youth Football Association (TYFA), FRIDAY NIGHT TYKES follows five teams on and off the field throughout the 2013 season, from pre-season training through the state championships. Along the way, cheerleaders cheer, tailgaters barbecue and the crowd goes wild, but intense rivalries flare, parents and coaches clash and the young players face some very adult pressures and concerns, from extreme training drills, heckling from rabid fans, and balancing on-the-field expectations against a typical off-the-field childhood.

episodes.name: Weakness Leaving the Body
episodes.overview: The Northeast Colts and Judson Jr. Rockets may share a home field, but these neighbors are far from friendly. After years of dominance, the Jr. Rockets might not be the best team on their own field. Coming off a blowout of the Warriors, the Colts enter the season's biggest grudge match with a lot of confidence. Can the Jr. Rockets scouts craft a killer game plan and show the Colts whose house they're in?

episodes.name: Whose House
episodes.overview: The Northeast Colts and Judson Jr. Rockets may share a home field, but these neighbors are far from friendly. After years of dominance, the Jr. Rockets might not be the best team on their own field. Coming off a blowout of the Warriors, the Colts enter the season's biggest grudge match with a lot of confidence. Can the Jr. Rockets scouts craft a killer game plan and show the Colts whose house they're in?

episodes.name: Now They're Playing Scared
episodes.overview: Can the Predators sting the Outlaws for their first points allowed of the season, or will fear of injury derail their squad?

episodes.name: Protect Our Kids!
episodes.overview: Tensions flare between parents and coaches over questionable hits in a game between the Outlaws and Jr. Broncos.

episodes.name: Why?
episodes.overview: Jr. Broncos Coach Chavarria deals with trouble at home. Meanwhile, Jr. Rockets president Dyson takes over the team's offense.

episodes.name: All for Nothing
episodes.overview: The Jr. Broncos try to salvage a brutal season, the Predators challenge the undefeated Colts, and the Outlaws settle an old score.

episodes.name: Today is the Test
episodes.overview: Bragging rights are on the line in this battle of the unbeatens! The Colts and Outlaws are locking horns in the season's final week. Can the Outlaws contain Colts' ace in the hole, running back Tadion Lott? Or will a true offensive threat doom their defense's perfect season? Meanwhile, the Jr. Broncos have a shot at getting back to an even record and keeping that glimmer of playoff hope alive--but a formidable Jr. Rockets team stands in their way. Can the miracle comeback continue?

episodes.name: Win or Go Home
episodes.overview: The playoffs brackets are announced, and teams throughout the state prepare to make their run at the state championship.

episodes.name: Send Them Home
episodes.overview: The days are getting shorter, but the playoffs stretch on. First up, the Predators hope to keep their Cinderella story going after a big upset in the first round--but will injury doom their season? Meanwhile, the Colts and Outlaws cruise through the second round on a collision course. Can the Colts capture redemption, or will things play out much the same in the rematch? See who secures city bragging rights and who gets sent home in a Thanksgiving matchup for the ages!

episodes.name: Finish What We Started
episodes.overview: In the season finale, the playoffs roll on and the Outlaws are just two wins away from becoming Texas state champions. After beating the Mission Mustangs, the Outlaws advance to the state finals and face their toughest competition yet--the Houston Kid Cougars. Despite a nearly perfect season, the unity of the most disciplined team in the league will be tested. The coaches clash when Coach Tony wants to deviate from the team itinerary, put family first and take his son Lucas to a football game--risking Lucas's chance of starting. Will Coach Fred stick to his word and keep Lucas out of the game?

episodes.name: Tackling Tykes
episodes.overview: Spiraling off of the recent national debate surrounding youth football, this 90-minute special goes beyond a mere season recap and explores issues surrounding competitive youth sports in America. Hosted by The Insider's Kevin Frazier, Tackling Tykes will feature thoughtful discussion and heated debates on topics such as safety, the role of coaches and parents, values learned in youth sports, and more. Additionally, coaches and parents from Friday Night Tykes discuss their feelings about the passionate response the series has garnered from viewers.

episodes.name: Welcome to the Juniors
episodes.overview: The teams of the Texas Youth Football Association kick off another season, putting last year's coaches' suspensions behind them as they pursue this year's championship.

episodes.name: Conduct Unbecoming
episodes.overview: After an on-field melee marred last week's Colts win against the Steelers, TYFA investigates taking disciplinary measures against the coaches, including Colts Head Coach Marecus Goodloe.

episodes.name: What's Wrong with My Dad?
episodes.overview: The Outlaws must face two opponents this week: the Jr. Broncos, and escalating tension among the Outlaws' coaching staff.

episodes.name: It Ain't Nothing Personal
episodes.overview: After an incident between parents during last weekend's game, the Lobos put the Hurt family on notice. Outlaws Head Coach Fred Davis also asserts his authority as he confronts bickering coaches on his staff. Meanwhile, the Colts and Head Coach Marecus Goodloe must deal with every football parent's worst nightmare -- the reality of a head injury.

episodes.name: Good Luck But You Suck
episodes.overview: After a heartbreaking loss to the Del Valle Ducks, Colts Head Coach Marecus Goodloe must regroup and get his team ready to take on their biggest rivals: the San Antonio Outlaws.

episodes.name: What Are We Doing?
episodes.overview: Yet more challenges for the Colts and Head Coach Marecus Goodloe. With another head injury suffered, is it really safe for the kids to continue playing?

episodes.name: We Ain't in the Playoffs Yet
episodes.overview: In the final week of the regular season, Marecus Goodloe and the Colts face a must-win game against the Spartans in order to qualify for the playoffs.

episodes.name: I Got My Light Back
episodes.overview: The playoffs brackets are announced, and teams throughout the state prepare to make their run at the state championship.

episodes.name: Men Cry Better
episodes.overview: With the State Championship game at stake, the defending champion Outlaws face their biggest test against the top-seeded Cy-Fair Ravens from Houston.

episodes.name: Divine Intervention
episodes.overview: The season comes down to one game: The State Championship. As they face off against the Mustangs, the Outlaws come into the game hoping to defend the title they won last year, but will Assistant Coach Tony Coley be on the sidelines? After last week's semi-final win, an enraged Coley left the field early and did not participate in the team's celebration. Can the already fragile relationship between Coley and Head Coach Fred Davis survive this latest blow-up, and what impact will it have on the Outlaws as they face the biggest game of the year?

episodes.name: Ten Other Offers
episodes.overview: As a new football season gets underway, teams in the Texas Youth Football Association jockey to recruit the league's most elite 10 and 11 year-old players while brand new organizations like the Texas Storm and the San Antonio Seahawks aim to prove that they belong in the country's most competitive youth football league.

episodes.name: The Kids Are Watching
episodes.overview: A coaching dispute turns ugly as the Seahawks take the field for their first game. Meanwhile, Predators Head Coach John Collins copes with PTSD, and the small town Yoakum Outlawz unveil their unorthodox approach to practice as they prepare for the Hurt family led Texas Storm.

episodes.name: Do You Want to Be a Loser
episodes.overview: A Seahawks coach is forced to deal with his anger after questions arise over how to best motivate the kids. Meanwhile, Texas Storm head coach Paul Hurt attempts to turn things around amid the challenges of running a new organization, and the San Antonio Outlaws struggle to maintain their dominance in a new league.

episodes.name: Ain't No Made-for-TV Movie
episodes.overview: John Collins walks the line between dad and coach as his Predators square off against the undefeated Broncos. And the San Antonio Outlaws aim to bounce back from the sting of their first loss in two years.

episodes.name: Storms Don't Scare Me
episodes.overview: A neighborhood rivalry is escalated to a turf war amid rumors of a coach targeting a star player. And the Yoakum Outlawz aim to continue their dominance as coaches are forced to control their emotions over questionable calls.

episodes.name: Jesus in Football Cleats
episodes.overview: Tensions rise among Outlaws coaches when a star player's future is put at risk. And a Yoakum Outlawz vs Predators game turns ugly when aggressive hitting leads to a brawl on the field.

episodes.name: When the Rabbit Has the Gun
episodes.overview: The Seahawks seek redemption in a disappointing season, and a heated dispute amongst parents at a Broncos game leads to a major rift in the organization.

episodes.name: Two Danny Devitos
episodes.overview: On the eve of the TYFA playoffs, the Mission Mustangs and Texas Storm are poised to make a run. And the San Antonio Outlaws look to continue their dominance as they square off against the only team that has beaten them in three years in the Snoop League State Championship.

episodes.name: I'm Not Ready to Be Done Yet
episodes.overview: With the TYFA Playoffs underway, the Mission Mustangs set their sights on a tough opponent, and the Yoakum Outlawz find themselves in an unfamiliar position.

episodes.name: Babies from Texas
episodes.overview: A state champion will be crowned in TYFA, and the San Antonio Outlaws make the long journey to California as they vie for a National Championship in the Snoop Youth Football League.

episodes.name: What's Your Malfunction
episodes.overview: Another season of football kicks off in Texas as the San Antonio Outlaws set out to prove they are the premiere youth football team in the nation. And a controversial hit sparks outrage as the Hurt family led Texas Storm take on a new organization led by Texas Youth Football Association Commissioner Chris Davis.

episodes.name: Home of the Gods
episodes.overview: The San Antonio Outlaws look to continue their dominance amid tensions over the recruiting of an elite 12 year-old quarterback. And a turf war between neighboring organizations gets settled on the field.

episodes.name: God Don't Like Ugly
episodes.overview: A youth football game turns ugly as parents and coaches become outraged by aggressive play. And the San Antonio Outlaws face their toughest competition yet.

episodes.name: We All Failed Him
episodes.overview: The Judson Jr Rockets look to continue their winning ways, and the Venom look for answers in the wake of an ugly act of misconduct by a coach.

episodes.name: Be the Adult
episodes.overview: In the aftermath of last weeks altercation between adult and child, the Venom try to heal and move forward as an organization. The Steelers face off against the 210 Outlaws in a battle of undefeated teams.

episodes.name: Ain't the Time to Be Holding Hands
episodes.overview: The San Antonio Outlaws begin the playoffs and with star Myzel Miller banged up they welcome back an old TYFA superstar. The Steelers parents case a ruckus in the stands and after a controversial loss the 210 take on another tough opponent, the Jr. Rockets.

episodes.name: Ain't Got to Cheat Us to Beat Us
episodes.overview: As the Outlaws' march toward a state championship, they deal with a cloud of controversy. The TYFA regular season comes to an end with some teams saying goodbye and a marque matchup when the Rockets take on the undefeated Steelers.

episodes.name: Ruined by Adults
episodes.overview: The TYFA playoffs begin and the Rockets first round matchup is an absolute slugfest. Marecus Goodloe considers his options after another tough day on the Outlaws sideline.

episodes.name: My Mama Not Here
episodes.overview: The Rockets deal with fallout from their playoff melee and their future in TYFA is questioned. The march to the TYFA championship continues with a rematch of one the most contentious regular season games of year.

episodes.name: If You Wanna Show, I'll Give You One
episodes.overview: On the season Finale of Friday Night Tykes, two champions will be crowned.
